title: Accountant Job at Brainshare Technologies & Services Nigeria Limited
content:
Brainshare Technologies & Services Nigeria Limited is a Telecom services provider. We provider internet services and other value added services through our fiber optic infrastructure.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant
Job Location: Lagos Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Main Duties
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Assisting the CFO in day-to-day financial operations, including budgeting, financial forecasting, and cash flow management.
	Responsible for ensuring compliance with the monthly tax remittances – VAT, WHT. PAYE Tax and other similar taxes to FIRS and LIRS.
	Ensure compliance with monthly staff Pension remittance and other statutory deduction.
	Support in the preparation for the tax audit exercise – documentation and other activities precedent to, during and after the tax audit.
	Support in the filing and documentation of all statutory compliance Certificates, required for the company's business operations.
	Support in the update and review of periodic financial and management reports.
	Support in the application and documentation for the various financing arrangements.
	Support during the statutory audit exercise.
	Support the CFO in financial analysis, providing insights and recommendations to improve financial performance.
	Collaborating with other departments to gather financial information and support decision-making processes.
	Monitoring financial transactions, ensuring proper documentation and adherence to internal controls.
	Assisting in the preparation of annual budgets and variance analysis.
	Staying up-to-date with changes in accounting regulations and ensuring compliance in financial operations.
	Performing other duties as assigned by the CFO.


Personal Qualities & Qualifications


	Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	Must have 3 years plus of cognate experience in a similar position from reputable big organization.
	Strong knowledge of accounting principles, practices, and regulations.
	Proficiency in advanced MS Excel and accounting software especially Zoho Books.
	Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities.
	Strong attention to detail and accuracy in financial data analysis.
	Ability to work independently and meet tight deadlines.
	Effective communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams and present financial information.
	Experience with financial reporting and auditing processes.
	Knowledge of tax regulations and compliance.
	Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive financial information.
	Demonstrates sense of urgency & tenacious at work.
	Candidate must reside around Lagos Island, Lekki-Ajah Axis.


Salary
N250,000 - N300,000 / Month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@brainshare.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Procurement Manager Job at Monument Distillers Nigeria Limited
content:
Monument Distillers Nigeria Limited (MDN) launched in Nigeria in March 2019 with the acquisition of the 1960 Rootz Bitters brand and the state-of-the-art manufacturing plant. Since then, the company has gone from strength to strength, moving Rootz’ production facility to Lagos.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Manager

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We’re looking for a Procurement Manager who will lead and manage the organization’s end-to-end procurement processes.
	This role is responsible for sourcing, negotiating, contracting, and maintaining strong vendor relationships, ensuring cost-effective and timely acquisition of goods and services critical to our business.


Responsibilities
This role reports to the Chief Operating Officer (COO).

The candidate will have the following duties and responsibilities:


	Develop and implement the procurement policy for the organization in line with best practice and ensure strict adherence to procedure.
	Lead and manage the end-to-end procurement cycle (P2P), including sourcing, vendor selection, contracting, and delivery tracking.
	Achieve the most value for the organization by negotiating terms, conditions, and pricing with the suppliers. This entails striking a balance between cost, quality, and timeliness.
	Develop and manage a vendor selection and evaluation system, including identifying, assessing, registering, and maintaining a reliable database of qualified suppliers to meet MDN’s procurement needs.
	Work closely with the warehouse and inventory teams to ensure stock levels are maintained within the set KPI level and to ensure no stockouts.
	Identify and implement cost-savings opportunities without compromising quality or delivery timelines.
	Work closely with the demand and planning team to ensure a proper reorder level to avoid stockouts.
	Develop & lead the Procurement Team, supervising all procurement activities and fostering continuous improvement.
	Track and report on key procurement metrics, such as spend, cost savings, and supplier performance.
	Identify and mitigate risks associated with Procurement, such as supply chain disruptions or defaults.
	Collaborate with internal stakeholders, which include operations, marketing, finance, legal, Admin, HR teams, etc., and oversee close coordination of procurement efforts to align with organizational goals and objectives
	Evaluate supplier performance, address non-conformities, and resolve any issues or conflicts to ensure service quality and compliance.
	Prepare and maintain all procurement documentation/records, including analysis, reports, prices, suppliers’ information, etc.
	Work closely with finance to resolve invoices and other issues related to vendors’ delivery.


Qualifications & Experience


	B.Sc. / HND in Supply Chain Management, Accounting, any related science, Social Science, and Engineering discipline from a reputable institution
	Minimum of 10 years of experience in a procurement function (preferably FMCG), with at least 3 years in a supervisory role
	Professional/Post-Graduate Qualification is an advantage
	Experience in sourcing techniques, contract management, Supplier relationship management, and Supply chain management.


Our ideal candidate must have:


	Strong knowledge of Procurement Principles, Process, and Documentation
	Relationship Building/Management & Stakeholder Management Skills
	Good Communication & Negotiation Skills
	Team Spirit & Collaboration Skills
	Leadership Skills
	Time Management, Planning & Organisational Skills
	Good Analytical & Strategic Thinking Skills
	Ability to deliver under a set time frame
	Business & Report Writing Skills
	Strong Business Acumen & Decision-Making Skills
	IT Proficiency (Microsoft Excel & Procurement Software).


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV as an attachment to: recruitment@kensingtondistillers.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Human Resources & Administration Assistant Manager Job at DreamCity Property & Investment Limited
content:
DreamCity Property & Investment Limited remains at the vanguard of residential and commercial real estate development across major cities in Nigeria delivering reliable structures with qualified infrastructure, luxury apartments in highbrow cities, and commercial real estate with good returns for our investors, who have over time become part of our success story.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources & Administration Assistant Manager
Job Location: Abuja (FCT) and Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Develop and implement comprehensive HR strategies, policies, and programs to align with organizational objectives.

title: Group Head, Administration Job at Sifax Group
content:
Sifax Group is one of Africa’s fastest growing multinational corporations with diverse interests in Maritime, Aviation, Haulage & Logistics, Oil & Gas and Hospitality.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Group Head, Administration

Job Location: Apapa, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-Time
Work Mode: Fully Onsite

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	As the Group Head, Administration, you will oversee daily administrative operations and lead a multi-disciplinary team to ensure efficient, secure, and cost-effective support services across the Group.
	You will be instrumental in developing strategic initiatives that align with the organization's growth objectives, while streamlining processes and enhancing service delivery across all administrative domains.
	You will report directly to the Group Corporate Director and supervise key units including facility management, fleet, protocol, store/inventory, and corporate security operations.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement strategic administrative processes to support organizational goals.
	Supervise general administrative functions across all business units.
	Manage facilities, property, fleet, and security operations to ensure compliance, efficiency, and safety.
	Oversee expatriate quota management and support services.
	Monitor and control administrative budgets across the Group.
	Ensure business continuity through proactive risk and security management.
	Drive improvements in inventory management and procurement systems.
	Deliver high-quality logistics and travel operations.
	Manage vendor relationships and contracts for outsourced services.
	Foster a culture of professionalism, continuous improvement, and excellence within the administrative team.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree (HND/BSc) in Business Administration, Accounting, Economics, or a related field.
	Minimum of 10 years of experience in administration, with at least 4 years in a senior leadership role.
	MBA or advanced degree is an advantage.
	Relevant professional certifications (e.g., Certified Administrative Professional) are highly desirable.
	Proven experience managing large teams and multi-location administrative functions.
	Strong project management, planning, and organizational skills.
	Excellent stakeholder management and vendor coordination abilities.
	Must possess solid government liaison experience (e.g., Nigerian Police Force, LASBCA, other parastatals).
